'''George A. Milliken, Ph.D.''' is [[emeritus professor]] of [[statistics]] at [[Kansas State University]]. He is a Fellow of the [[American Statistical Association]]<ref>[http://www.stat911.com/staff/index.shtml Welcome to Stat911.com] {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5vOWl362C|date =2010-12-31}}</ref> and has published many papers in various statistical journals. Dr. Milliken is a co-author of the three volume ''Analysis of Messy Data'' series (Volume 1: [[Design of experiments|Designed Experiments]]; Volume 2: Nonreplicated Experiments; Volume 3: [[ANCOVA|Analysis of Covariance]]) and the co-author of the book ''[[SAS System]] for [[Mixed model|Mixed Models]].''

Dr. Milliken's books are widely referenced in the statistical research community.<ref>[http://www.amazon.com/dp/0412990814 Amazon.com: Analysis of Messy Data, Volume I: Designed Experiments (Analysis of Messy Data): George A. Milliken, Dallas E. Johnson: Books] {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5vOWlT8Ll|date =2010-12-31}}</ref> He has placed a significant emphasis of his professional research on the following areas:
* Nonlinear mixed models
* [[Linear model|Linear]] and nonlinear models
* Design of experiments, appropriate [[experimental unit]]s
* Mixed models, repeated measures, non-replicated experiments
* Complex designs from designed experiments and [[observational study|observational studies]]
